critique: The document is an executive order that aims to increase accountability in federal agencies by requiring that senior appointees sign off on agency rules. This could be seen as a move towards deregulation, as it makes it more difficult for agencies to issue new rules. It also centralizes power in the executive branch, as it gives the President more control over agency rulemaking. The document does not address immigration, national security, or social inclusion. It is difficult to say whether the document is liberal or conservative, as it could be seen as both. On the one hand, it could be seen as conservative because it seeks to reduce the power of federal agencies. On the other hand, it could be seen as liberal because it seeks to increase accountability in government.
